text:
Robbie Coltrane OBE (born Anthony Robert McMillan; 30 March 1950) is a Scottish actor, author and comedian. He is known both for his role as Dr. Eddie "Fitz" Fitzgerald in the British TV series "Cracker" during the 1990s and as Rubeus Hagrid in the "Harry Potter" movies.
Life.
Coltrane was born in Rutherglen, South Lanarkshire. He now lives in Killearn Stirlingshire. He has a son named Spencer and a daughter named Alice.
Career.
Coltrane began his acting career in his early twenties. He took the stage name Coltrane in tribute to jazz saxophonist John Coltrane In 2006, Robbie received an OBE for his services to drama.
